The prism is centered on a white background. **Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0898, 0.0]. **Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1). Face_1 contains a single loop (loop_1), which is a closed path consisting of six line segments. - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.2422] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.2422], End Point [0.2125, 0.2403] - Line 4: Start Point [0.2125, 0.2403], End Point [0.2125, 0.4219] - Line 5: Start Point [0.2125, 0.4219], End Point [0.0, 0.4219] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.4219], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Scaling the 2D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transforming the 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extruding the 2D Sketch to Generate the 3D Model** Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal vector to a depth of 0.0449 units. Also, extrude the sketch in the opposite direction of the normal vector by the same depth. The final dimensions of the part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0898 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>

The curved side of the first rectangular prism should have a radius that is equal to the width of the first rectangular prism.</description>
